title: 109_hr4361
content: Expansion and enhancement of educational assistance for survivors and dependents of veterans. Termination of Durational Limitation on Use of Educational Assistance: Section 3511 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to allow educational assistance payments for individuals ordered to active duty under specific sections of title 10 without affecting their entitlement. Section 3511 of title 38, United States Code is amended to address interruptions in pursuit of educational programs for individuals on active duty under specific sections of title 10. Amendments include changes to section headings and provisions for special restorative training at the request of eligible individuals. The Secretary may determine if an eligible person needs special restorative training and prescribe a suitable course. The course may include elements contributing to an educational program. Additionally, the age limit for dependents' eligibility is extended to the thirtieth birthday, and adjustments are made to the amount of educational assistance under Section 3532 of title 38, United States Code. Section 3532 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to set the aggregate amount of educational assistance for eligible individuals at $80,000. This assistance can be used for various educational purposes, including institutional courses, full-time programs with training phases in business or industrial establishments, and farm cooperative programs. A farm cooperative program is one of the educational assistance options available for eligible individuals under Section 3532 of title 38, United States Code. This program consists of institutional agricultural courses scheduled within forty-four weeks of any twelve-month period, and the individual must be concurrently engaged in relevant agricultural employment. If pursuing education in the Philippines, educational assistance is paid at a rate of $0.50 for each dollar. The maximum amount for licensing or certification tests is $2,000 or the test fee, whichever is less. Amendments have been made to Section 3533 of title 38, United States Code. Amendments to Section 3533 of title 38, United States Code include entitlement to tutorial assistance without charge, repeal of Section 3534, and modifications to Sections 3542 and 3543. Amendments to various sections of title 38, United States Code include redesignating paragraphs, adjusting rates of educational assistance, and modifying eligibility criteria. Amendments to title 38, United States Code involve redefining eligibility criteria for educational assistance allowances for veterans. Section 3524 is also amended to remove references to "allowance." Amendments to title 38, United States Code involve redefining eligibility criteria for educational assistance for veterans by removing references to "allowance" in various sections. Amendments to title 38, United States Code involve redefining eligibility criteria for educational assistance for veterans by updating sections 3531, 3532, 3533, and 3541. The amendments made by this section, including special restorative training, will take effect upon the enactment of the Act. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is required to increase educational assistance under section 3532 for fiscal year 2006, despite the effective date specified in section 3564 of title 38, United States Code.
